category.name: Family Prayers
category.description: Prayers for family devotion and spiritual growth

content.text:
LORD OF ALL LIFE,
There is one thing that deserves all my attention and passion:
living out the purpose I was made for—
to glorify You who gave me life,
and to do all the good I can for others.
Honestly, life isn't worth living if it's not used for this noble purpose.

Yet, Lord, so few people think this way.
Most people seem to live for themselves,
without much or any thought for Your glory or the good of others.
They desperately desire and chase after the riches, status, and pleasures of this life,
as if they think wealth, popularity, and fun could make their souls truly happy.

But what a false and deceptive dream that is!
And soon, those who are caught up in it will be miserable,
because all true happiness comes from loving You
and being holy as You are holy.

O may I never fall for the attitudes and emptiness,
the sinful desires and foolishness of this world.
It's a place of deep sorrow, a vast emptiness.
Time is just a moment, a vapor,
and all its pleasures are like empty bubbles or gusts of wind;
nothing satisfying can be found in them.

Give me the grace to always stay in my relationship with You,
and to reject the illusion of fame—both now and in the future—
along with all sinful pleasures and profits.

Help me to know, deep in my bones,
that there can be no true happiness,
no fulfilling of Your purpose for me,
apart from a life lived in and for Your Son, Jesus.
